docs.snippet: Lionsgate's Expendables 3 opening weekend could be dampened by a leaked copy downloaded as many as 5 million times. But analysts say moviegoers may still show up at theaters for the blockbuster extravaganza. Lily Jamali reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lionsgate's Expendables 3 opening weekend could be dampened by a leaked copy downloaded as many as 5 million times. But analysts say moviegoers may still show up at theaters for the blockbuster extravaganza. Lily Jamali reports.

headline.print_headline: SeaWorld Plans Bigger Killer Whale Environments
headline.main: SeaWorld Plans Bigger Killer Whale Environments

docs.snippet: After more than a year of public criticism of its treatment of killer whales, SeaWorld said Friday that it will build new, larger environments at its theme parks and will fund additional research on the animals along with programs to protect ocean...
docs.lead_paragraph: After more than a year of public criticism of its treatment of killer whales, SeaWorld said Friday that it will build new, larger environments at its theme parks and will fund additional research on the animals along with programs to protect ocean health and whales in the wild.

headline.print_headline: Schippers Wins Second Gold With Year's Best Time
headline.main: Schippers Wins Second Gold With Year's Best Time

docs.snippet: Dutch sprinter Dafne Schippers ran the fastest 200 meters this year on Friday to collect her second gold medal of the European championships....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dutch sprinter Dafne Schippers ran the fastest 200 meters this year on Friday to collect her second gold medal of the European championships.

headline.print_headline: IBM Says Sale of Low-End Server Business Gets Regulator Approval
headline.main: IBM Says Sale of Low-End Server Business Gets Regulator Approval

docs.snippet: International Business Machines Corp IBM.N said on Friday that U.S. regulators had approved the $2.3 billion sale of its low-end server business to Lenovo Group Ltd 0992.HK, as the company continues its shift to more profitable software and servic...
docs.lead_paragraph: International Business Machines Corp IBM.N said on Friday that U.S. regulators had approved the $2.3 billion sale of its low-end server business to Lenovo Group Ltd 0992.HK, as the company continues its shift to more profitable software and services like cloud computing and data analytics.

headline.print_headline: Lawyers: FBI Removed Lead Agent in Corruption Case
headline.main: Lawyers: FBI Removed Lead Agent in Corruption Case

docs.snippet: A lead FBI agent in a sting that produced criminal charges against a state senator and 19 other people was removed from the case over unspecified financial improprieties, lawyers for one defendant said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A lead FBI agent in a sting that produced criminal charges against a state senator and 19 other people was removed from the case over unspecified financial improprieties, lawyers for one defendant said.

headline.main: Sheriff and Son Accused of Pistol-Whipping New Mexico Motorist

docs.lead_paragraph: FBI agents arrested a New Mexico sheriff and his son on Friday after the lawman allegedly pistol-whipped a motorist following a high-speed car chase, officials said.

headline.print_headline: Fire Erupts Under New Jersey's Pulaski Skyway During Rebuilding
headline.main: Fire Erupts Under New Jersey's Pulaski Skyway During Rebuilding

docs.snippet: Work on a project to rebuild New Jersey's crumbling Pulaski Skyway ground to a halt on Friday afternoon when a fire erupted along the supporting base of the elevated roadway that connects Jersey City and Newark, a state transportation official sai...
docs.lead_paragraph: Work on a project to rebuild New Jersey's crumbling Pulaski Skyway ground to a halt on Friday afternoon when a fire erupted along the supporting base of the elevated roadway that connects Jersey City and Newark, a state transportation official said.

headline.print_headline: Russian Assures Hagel on Ukrainian Relief
headline.main: Russian Assures Hagel on Ukrainian Relief

docs.snippet: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoygu "guaranteed" Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Friday that no Russian troops are involved in the transport of humanitarian relief supplies to eastern Ukraine, a Pentagon spokesman said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoygu "guaranteed" Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Friday that no Russian troops are involved in the transport of humanitarian relief supplies to eastern Ukraine, a Pentagon spokesman said.
